title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: The New England Patriots released a hype video before facing the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Head coach Mike Vrabel emphasized team identity and player development in the video.
Wide receiver Stefon Diggs rallied the team with motivational remarks highlighting their uniqueness.

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, pleaded guilty to charges of obstruction and video voyeurism involving female co-workers at the Westminster Post Office.
Testagrossa secretly recorded female colleagues in the restroom, hiding a camera that was discovered on March 28, 2025.
Facing up to 20 years in prison, Testagrossa's sentencing is scheduled for May 12, 2026, with significant fines possible.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Two Jewish advocacy groups filed a lawsuit against Medford over its values-based investment ordinance.
The ordinance prohibits investment in industries like fossil fuels and defense contracting, affecting general city funds.
The lawsuit claims the ordinance violates federal and state law, prioritizing ideology over financial standards.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need MVP-level performance from quarterback Drake Maye to overcome Seattle's strong defense in Super Bowl LX.
Applying defensive pressure on Seattle QB Sam Darnold could lead to turnovers and swing momentum for New England.
Stifling Seattle's run game, especially against Kenneth Walker, is crucial for Patriots to control third-down situations.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 during his Patriots tenure, a tradition linked to USC's Junior Seau.
McGinest explained that Junior Seau's success at USC led to No. 55 being honored for top linebackers.
Junior Seau sought McGinest's permission to wear No. 55 with the Patriots, showing mutual respect.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly recording 13 inches from the storm.
Snowfall was significant in Bristol County with Dartmouth receiving 8.2 inches by late afternoon.
The National Weather Service and local observers reported snow totals; northeastern Massachusetts was most affected.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC this Sunday, joining analyst Cris Collinsworth in Santa Clara.
Tirico will follow the Super Bowl with NBC's Olympic studio program, 'Primetime in Milan', despite a busy NBA schedule.
NBC's Super Bowl coverage will include reporters Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung, with Maria Taylor hosting pregame shows.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are 4.5-point underdogs against the Seattle Seahawks for Super Bowl LX in Santa Clara, California.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest to win a Super Bowl at 23 if New England wins.
Seahawks boast leading scoring defense, but Patriots excel in playoffs with three wins over top-five defenses.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel consulted Bill Belichick and Andy Reid for advice before coaching his first Super Bowl with the Patriots.
Patriots' offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, set for his 10th Super Bowl, contributed experience and advice to Vrabel's preparations.
Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season, earning Coach of the Year, but faces historical odds for a Super Bowl win.

title: 5 things at stake during the Patriots’ Super Bowl rematch with the Seahawks
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots aim to set an NFL record with a seventh Super Bowl win, breaking their tie with Pittsburgh.
A victory would make Mike Vrabel the first to win a Super Bowl with the Patriots as both player and coach.
A Patriots win could mark the greatest single-season turnaround, improving from 4-13 to Super Bowl champions.
